data.title: Liverpool Beatles Museum
data.text:
The Liverpool Beatles Museum is thrilled to invite you to join us for an unforgettable Beatle Week during the August Bank Holiday. We have an exciting line up of events that will bring you closer to the magic of The Beatles, featuring special guests who played...

As Pride Month unfolds, it's essential to reflect not only on the prominent figures in LGBTQ+ history but also on those whose impact extends into realms beyond sexuality. Brian Epstein, known predominantly as the manager of The Beatles, was one such individual whose...

The Musical Box, Liverpool's oldest record shop, has long been a cornerstone of the city's vibrant music scene. Founded by Jack Lewis in 1947 and carried forward by his wife Dorothy in 1951, this beloved shop has remained a family-run business for four generations....

Yesterday was a momentous occasion for Beatles fans and history enthusiasts alike as we were invited to the unveiling of a new blue plaque commemorating the birthplace of George Harrison. The event took place at 12 Arnold Grove in Wavertree, Liverpool, the house where...

Today, the Liverpool Beatles Museum was honoured to host George Sephton, the legendary voice of Liverpool Football Club, for a very special presentation. Sephton brought with him a guitar signed by none other than Liverpool's charismatic manager, Jürgen Klopp. The...

At the Liverpool Beatles Museum, every visitor brings with them a unique story, but this month, we had the pleasure of hosting some truly special guests! One such visitor was the esteemed lyricist Tim Rice, who graced our halls ahead of his appearance at the Liverpool...

In April The Liverpool Beatles Museum hosted for the first time an extraordinary event that brought together a vibrant mix of creativity and community spirit: "The Art of Sharing: An Evening for Artists." This special evening celebrated the diverse talents of...

We are thrilled to announce a new addition to our collection at the Liverpool Beatles Museum: a Japanese tea service bought by George Harrison during the height of Beatlemania. This exquisite set, one of three purchased by Harrison during the Beatles' tour of Japan in...

On Friday, March 22nd, we hosted an event that was truly one for the books. Friends of the Museum gathered to celebrate the 60th anniversary of John Lennon's iconic work, In His Own Write, alongside some very special guests. The evening was filled with laughter,...

Big news from the Liverpool Beatles Museum today – we're thrilled to unveil a truly special addition to our collection: John and Yoko's very own 'acorns for peace'! The story of how the acorns found their way to the museum is an intriguing one! It began in 1968 when a...
